adam-wietrzyński-11389682.summary:
>18 years experience in automotive by biggest Tier 1 players (Delphi Automotive, Mahle, GKN Driveline, Valeo & Forvia - Faurecia)
> Senior Manager positions for past 13 years in Automotive and Machining industry (Quality Manager/Director, Quality & Risk Director) with interactions and management with cross functional (Customers, Operations, Suppliers, R&D, Process, Warranty, Quality, HR, Finance), international teams,
and multi-sites management experience
> Team Leader on Quality Task Force to solve Quality Issues, both internal and with OEM Customers
> 3,5 years experience in global leading consumer electronics provider - Dell Computers
> Supplier Quality Manager for over 6 years (auditing various production processes at suppliers, developing suppliers, supporting suppliers in production transfer processes
> Deep knowledge of the Automotive Quality Core Tools
> Collaborating on different cross-functional levels with big OEM’s (Toyota, BMW, Daimler - Mercedes Benz, Porsche, Audi, VW, Skoda, Seat, Volvo, JLR, MAN, Scania, Renault, PSA, TPCA, Honda, GM, Opel, FCA)
> As Voice of the Customer high Engagement was the key to be successful
> Proven KPI’s improvements: Customer PPM’s, # of Complaints, gaining Customer Quality Award
> On Quality & Supplier Quality functions strong influence and management of cross-functional teams - giving directions in remote environment not only into direct reports 
> Project member for 2 greenfield projects: Dell Computer (1,800 employees) and GKN Driveline (1, 100 employees)
> Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certified (2007), Lean Six Sigma Black Belt (2024)

positionHistory.title: Manufacturing Engineer - Technolog

positionHistory.title: Quality Manager - Kierownik Jakości

positionHistory.title: Head of Quality - Global Quality Director (IST AG - Endress & Hauser Group)

cdtc2010.summary: I am an accomplished professional with 30 years of experience in industries ranging from chemistry, construction, semiconductors, and electronics to defense industries. I hold extensive certifications in quality management, enterprise risk management, and business continuity, with a focus on operational excellence and team leadership across multi-cultural environments.

positionHistory.title: Process Engineer
positionHistory.description:
• Develop dry-etch process for fabrication of SAW-filters
• Optimization of existing processes. Qualify new equipment, transfer into production
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Process Engineer responsible for developing and optimizing processes, qualifying new equipment, and transferring processes into production, the candidate exhibits the responsibilities of a senior individual contributor with significant expertise. The role involves high complexity and requires substantial knowledge, aligning with Level 1C.

positionHistory.title: Process Engineer - Chemistry Manager - Health & Safety Manager
positionHistory.description:
• Process Engineer (02.1998 – 09.2004)
-	Develop new photolithography process by electrophoresis for fabrication of quartz resonators 
-	Design, test and qualify new products and equipment, transfer into production 
-	Manage analysis (physical, chemical, mechanical ...) with external partners

• Chemistry Manager, Health- & Safety Manager (2000 – 2004)
-	Manage warehouses (10 tones) of chemical products, organization of all delivery activities 
-	Search, qualify new subcontractor for chemical wastes treatment
-	Purchase chemical products (budget 400 kCHF/year)
-	Manage transports of dangerous products according to ADR
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: The candidate transitions from an individual contributor to a supervisory role during this position. Managing warehouses, purchasing chemical products, and overseeing health and safety indicates initial leadership exposure and responsibility for a small team, fitting Level 2A.

positionHistory.title: Multi-Plants Production Manager
positionHistory.description:
• Drive staff to achieve company goals. Build up strong and motivated team
• Liaise with Sales and plan, release, follow up manufacturing orders 
• Plan production ramp-up in optics and electronics departments 
• Manage the technology & equipment transfer to our plant in Malaysia
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Managing production across multiple plants, leading staff to achieve company goals, and managing technology transfers denote significant managerial responsibilities over larger teams and multiple functions. This aligns with Level 3B, where the candidate influences departmental quality outcomes and contributes to organizational planning.

positionHistory.title: Quality & Engineering Manager
positionHistory.description:
• Quality & Production Engineering
-	Responsible for all quality issues of the plant
-	Develop and improve products and production processes including analyze root causes of defects,
        record statistics
-	Simplify quality documents system. Perform audits intern & suppliers
-	Manage introduction of new products

• Customer Services
-	Handle all quality issues addressed by key customers
-	Create statistics of returned products and failures. Introduce corrective actions

• Lean Manufacturing
-	Take part to the implementation of Lean Manufacturing in the production floor
-	Realize values stream mapping, optimization of processes & material flow, waste elimination
       & reduction, visual management, one-piece-flow, set-up Kanban, improve material supply
-	Convert «straight production line» to «U-shaped production line»
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As the Quality & Engineering Manager responsible for all quality issues of the plant, leading audits, and implementing lean manufacturing, the candidate is managing a quality department with high complexity tasks, fitting Level 3A.

positionHistory.title: Quality - Safety - Environment Manager
positionHistory.description:
• Drive staff to achieve company goals. Build up strong and motivated team
• Liaise with Sales and plan, release, follow up manufacturing orders 
• Plan production ramp-up in optics and electronics departments 
• Manage the technology & equipment transfer to our plant in Malaysia
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Overseeing quality, safety, and environmental functions indicates managing multiple quality-related departments. Responsibilities involve cross-functional coordination and implementing strategies, aligning with Level 3A.

positionHistory.title: QHSE & CSR System Manager (Headquarter, 7 Sites)
positionHistory.description:
• Drive the transition to the last version of QHSE & CSR Standards (company-wide)
• Ensure that all requirements and key initiatives are aligned with company strategy
• Implement new management system software with a customer-oriented approach
• Organize & conduct suppliers audits & internal audits, root cause analysis
• Projects: Harmonize a security concept, management of dangerous goods
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Managing the quality function across seven sites from the headquarters involves strategic direction, significant complexity, and organizational impact. Setting company-wide quality standards and practices fits Level 3C.

positionHistory.title: Senior QRSSE Manager & Trade Compliance Officer
positionHistory.description: See the position of Thales Simulation & Training (Thales bought Ruag Simulation & Training in May 2022)
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: The candidate oversees multiple quality functions, including quality, risk, safety, security, environment, and trade compliance, with responsibilities that influence company policies and strategic direction at a global level. This aligns with Level 4A.

positionHistory.title: Senior Quality Security & HSE Manager
positionHistory.description:
• Quality Assurance
-	Ensure all required certificates for the BUs
-	Coordinate and drive the quality initiatives with others quality managers in Europe
-	Responsible for defining and maintaining quality objectives and measures
-	Prepare audits planning and is responsible for its compliance
-	Support for Compliance Initiatives 
-	Deploy new Thales' processes across the company and train all employees

• Health - Safety & Environment Officer at group level (CH, F, D, UAE, MY, AUS)
-	Ensure a good HSE level and that HSE goals are met
-	Coordinate and drive the HSE initiatives with local HSE managers abroad
-	Develop and implement HSE concept at BU level, perform key risks analysis for all CH sites 
-	Build up first-aid and emergency organization
-	Implement a HSE compliance tool   

• Security Officer
-	Ensure the compliance of Security Protocol and Personal Security  
-	Secured Access Management for employees
-	Assess physical security of major sites in CH 
-	Manage sensitive's cases with authorities

• Enterprise Risks Management
-	Implement and drive the ERM initiatives
-	Coordinate & drive ERM initiatives with other risk managers in D-F-UAE
-	Collect & assess all risks at company levels
-	Ensure Business Continuity by implementing mitigation measures

• Merge & Acquisition and Integration
-	Coordinate, harmonize the information for QRSSE & TC streams between F-CH-D-UAE
-	Manage data in Virtual Data Rooms 
-	Identify key QRSSE topics and ensure that they will be properly integrated in Thales
-	Identify gaps, implement improvement actions 

• Trade Compliance Officer at SECO & FDFA
-	Coordinate TC activities between TC specialists and internal stakeholders for new bids
-	Ensure Trade Compliance of the BUs and deploy TC directives group-wide
-	Implement new / (adapted) group-wide TC requirements
-	Ensuring effective handling of BU specific TC risks 
-	Contribute to the integration of the company into Thales SA and Thalesgroup
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Managing quality assurance, HSE initiatives, security, enterprise risk management, and trade compliance across multiple countries (CH, F, D, UAE, MY, AUS) demonstrates global oversight and significant strategic influence, fitting Level 4A.

positionHistory.title: Global Quality Manager in Projects
positionHistory.description: Skills: Anglais · Anglais parlé · Évaluation des risques · Esprit critique

Multicultural manager, focused on results, within a car manufacturer and an automotive supplier: 
● Multidisciplinary experiences, within quality and operational positions,
● The management of international suppliers quality networks,
● Management of technological disruptions, 
● The zero defect’s expectation within the automotive industry mindset,
● The management of regulatory constraints with their local specificities.

positionHistory.title: Production Manager
positionHistory.description:
Lead an Elementary Work Unit and then a manufacturing workshop, in order to achieve the objectives (Quality, Cost, Deadlines, Human Resources and Environment):
• Guarantee operational standards and improvements of the mass production workshop,
• Get involved upstream of new projects (product-process) and of their implementation,
• Pilot the skills’ improvement of co-workers by coaching, training and on-site support.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Production Manager leading an Elementary Work Unit and a manufacturing workshop, the candidate supervised a team focused on daily operations, including task assignments and problem-solving, aligning with '2A: First-Line Quality Supervisors'.

positionHistory.title: Suppliers Quality Project Manager
positionHistory.description:
Manage a team of Suppliers’ Quality Engineers based on the objectives of the Laguna Coupé project:
• Create and manage the budget of the team (staff, running costs, trainings),
• Check the convergence for the validation of the quality assurance (ANPQP) of incoming parts for the vehicle in coherence with project milestones, 
• Ensure and lead the implementation of progress action plans for all scopes of Suppliers’ Quality Engineers.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Suppliers Quality Project Manager, managing a team of Suppliers' Quality Engineers, creating budgets, and ensuring quality assurance for a project, the candidate had significant supervisory responsibilities with moderate complexity, aligning with '2B: Mid-Level Quality Supervisors'.

positionHistory.title: Suppliers Quality Corporate Manager
positionHistory.description:

• Ensure the development and relevant implementation of audit benchmarks for evaluating suppliers,
• Pilot the project to mutualize the resources of all SQA Dpt.,
• Coordinate with purchasing and engineering Dept., common approaches for suppliers (in particular the quality assurance process (ANPQP) for the development of suppliers’ parts).
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Suppliers Quality Corporate Manager, optimizing operations of French and international SQA departments, piloting projects, and coordinating with other departments, the candidate managed quality operations with cross-functional responsibility, aligning with '3A: Quality Managers'.

positionHistory.title: Industrial Projects Manager
positionHistory.description:
Coordinate all the industrial tasks required to start LCV vehicles on two assembly plants in order to achieve the objectives of the project:
• Involved in the design of the industrial plant’s framework and coordinated all activities necessary for the industrialization of LCV vehicles in two plants (including planning, robustness of product / process for each milestone).
• Fulfill the industrial performance QCTHR (as stated in the joint contract between Engineering and Manufacturing as well as in the Monozukuri performance).
• Represent the voice of manufacturing during the project. 

Hierarchically linked to the Director of Industrial Projects and functionally linked to the Chief Vehicle Engineer.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Industrial Projects Manager, coordinating industrial tasks across two assembly plants, involved in design and implementation, the candidate had responsibilities affecting multiple plants, aligning with '3B: Senior Quality Supervisors'.

positionHistory.title: Body Shop Process Project Manager
positionHistory.description:
Manage a team of Industrial Functional Pilots and functionally all employees contributing to the industrial system:
• Set up, organise and manage the body shop project team and overall system, this is done to ensure definition of processes, supply and tryout of industrial systems for compliance of QCTHR and industrial performance objectives.
• Co-manage relations with the interface body shop (product and process) and the Production Department of the production site.

Hierarchically linked to the Project Development General Manager and functionally linked to the Industrial Project Director
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Body Shop Process Project Manager, managing a team and all employees contributing to the industrial system, ensuring compliance, and co-managing relations with various departments, the role involved significant complexity and cross-functional coordination, aligning with '3B: Senior Quality Supervisors'.

positionHistory.title: Product Groups SQA Director
positionHistory.description:
Lead the global SQA network for the Intuitive Control (CIC) and Connected Cars (CCC) Product Groups to ensure the quality of the components in project and mass-production:
• Structure, recruit managers and commodity engineers by regions according to the objectives set by the Group SQA and assess their performance,
• Validate in partnership with the Purchasing function, suppliers within the panel committee,
• Ensure compliance with the quality standards of the Group SQA, including the strict application of the Supplier Quality Manual (SQM) and the AQP.pp deliverables.

Hierarchically linked to the Product Groups Quality Directors, the Business Group Purchasing VP and functionally linked to the Group SQA Director.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Product Groups SQA Director, leading the global SQA network for product groups, structuring and recruiting managers and engineers by regions, ensuring compliance, the candidate had global responsibilities and significant strategic influence, aligning with '4A: Global Quality Leaders'.

positionHistory.title: Product Line Quality Director
positionHistory.description:
Manage the Quality network for the Switch and Smart Controls (ISC) Product Line to achieve Customers Satisfaction for Quality:
• Organize, recruit the VALEO Site Quality teams and Projects Quality teams within the perimeter according to the objectives set by the Product Group and assess their performance,
• Monitor and Control the conformity on Development and Production processes,
• Deploy the Quality culture and develop the Quality Improvement Plan and tools to achieve the quality objectives and physical indicators,
• Lead the Customer interface for Quality matters (Quality in development, in production and after sales).

Hierarchically linked to the Product Line VP and functionally linked to the Product Group Quality Director.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Product Line Quality Director, managing the quality network for a product line, organizing and recruiting site quality teams, leading customer interface, and linked to the Product Line VP, the candidate's role involved integrating quality strategies with overall business objectives, aligning with '4B: Executive Directors of Quality'.

positionHistory.title: Group Project Quality Manager
positionHistory.description:
Manage the Project Quality teams worldwide, as a group function:
• Ensure, mainly in project development phase, that products are designed and manufactured according to the international standards, customer’s requirements, and LEM’s internal rules,
• Maintain & reinforce LEM quality culture with target of developing and manufacturing safer and more
reliable products,
• Ensure integrity and respect of LEM’s development framework, according to IPD (Integrated Product
Development),
• Monitor and manage KPIs and ensure reporting and corrective actions wherever needed.

Hierarchically linked to the Quality VP
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Group Project Quality Manager, managing project quality teams worldwide as a group function, ensuring products are designed and manufactured according to standards, reinforcing quality culture, and linked to the Quality VP, the candidate's role involves strategic leadership at the global level, aligning with '4B: Executive Directors of Quality'.

saverio-baldini-75448a14.summary:
26+ years of experience in “end to end” Quality management in consumer goods design, industrialization, manufacturing and field service environments for World Class Quality Companies like Indesit Company, Whirlpool, Nespresso, Nestle and Bosch.

Quality strategic mindset focused on “Right the First Time” and Continuous Improvement of Products, Processes and Business Processes.

Expert on Customer Satisfaction Analysis, Product and Process improvement advanced methods.

Author of the manual “The Quality Temple” (available on shelf from November 2024 by McGraw Hill) a lean effective Quality System focus on 3 Pillars: Customer, Product, Process and their connection. A Quality System based on the “Best of Best” of today industry Quality processes.

Experienced in Quality Transformation projects like:
-	Indesit Company – Whirlpool corporation Quality integration (leader role)
-	World Class Manufacturing program leader for implementation of WCM for Whirlpool Corporation manufacturing plants.

Lean six sigma certified Master Black Belt, WCM expert, Problem Solving Coach.

Extensive proven track record of successfully implemented Quality Systems and ISO 9000 multi-site certification.

-	SPC  manager (Statistical Process Control) and Incoming inspection/supplier quality manager

Heading Design Quality Team for Nespresso machines at Nestlé Technical Centre. A team of Quality Managers dedicated to: assure design Quality and product safety along all development process to Start of Production, OEM Quality Systems, Product Compliance. 

Responsible for Product Validation Laboratory.

Quality Continuous Improvement: product continuous improvement to grant the Best Customer Satisfaction, increase Customer loyalty and reduce Cost of Poor Quality (CoPQ).
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Continued to lead design quality teams and validation, maintaining executive-level responsibilities, aligning with an Executive Director of Quality (4B).

positionHistory.title: Head of Quality Management & Methods (Accessories C&S)
positionHistory.description: Leading the Quality Management & Methods Department for Bosch Power Tools Accessories (C&S). Responsible for Design, Manufacturing and Customer Quality.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Leading the Quality Management & Methods Department, overseeing design, manufacturing, and customer quality, aligning with an Executive Director of Quality (4B).

cedricbrieussel.summary:
With 30 years of extensive experience in the mechanical industry (including automotive and aeronautics) across various departments, I have good knowledge and skills related to the manufacturing of mechanical products. My approach is holistic, allowing me to understand the end-to-end processes seamlessly. My last experiences are related to Quality Control, but my expertises span a wide range of activities: Lean Manufacturing, Process Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing.

Throughout my career, I have demonstrated effective leadership by successfully managing teams. My management style is characterized by a focus on empowerment and involvement, where I prioritize the growth and engagement of my teammates in a collaborative and stable work environment,

positionHistory.title: Lean Expert - Process engineer
positionHistory.description: Implementation of Lean methods (5S, SMED, TPM, Kan-Ban, One-Piece-Flow, ...) - Process engineer for one product line.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a process engineer implementing Lean methods for one product line, the candidate was working independently on quality projects of moderate complexity, fitting the definition of a Mid-Level Quality Professional (1B).

positionHistory.title: Process Engineering Manager
positionHistory.description: MDesign and implementation of Manufacturing processes and equipments. Machining of casting parts, quenching, stamping, assembly. Investment of new production lines and special automated machines.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Process Engineering Manager overseeing the design and implementation of manufacturing processes and equipment, and investing in new production lines, the candidate managed complex projects and likely supervised a team, fitting the role of a Mid-Level Quality Supervisor (2B).

positionHistory.title: Production Manager
positionHistory.description: Management of a APU (Autonomous Production Unit) - 50 workers, 5 prodution lines - Machining, Assembly, Stamping, Quenching.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Production Manager overseeing an Autonomous Production Unit with 50 workers and 5 production lines, the candidate managed significant operations, made department-level decisions, and had a substantial impact on product and process quality, fitting the role of a Quality Manager (3A).

positionHistory.title: Logistics Manager
positionHistory.description: Supply Chain Management for the Heavy Truck plant (250 employees) - Procurement, Warehousing, Planning, Customer order management, Dispatching. Management of a team of 13 persons.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Logistics Manager responsible for Supply Chain Management in a plant with 250 employees, managing a team of 13 people, the candidate oversaw significant operations and made department-level decisions, fitting the role of a Quality Manager (3A).

positionHistory.title: Production Control Manager
positionHistory.description: Management of the Production Control - Procurement, Planning, Warehousing, Bill of Materials. Management of 5 teamleadersI (30 team members).
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Production Control Manager overseeing multiple functions (procurement, planning, warehousing, bill of materials), managing 5 team leaders and 30 team members, the candidate managed complex operations across multiple functions, fitting the role of a Senior Quality Manager (3B).

positionHistory.title: Production Manager
positionHistory.description: Management of a autonomous workshop manufacturing vacuum systems - Included the Manufacturing processes (assembly, painting, testing,  packaging) and the management of the Supply chain (procurement, warehousing, planning, dispatching) - Team of 20 employees.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Production Manager responsible for manufacturing processes and supply chain management, overseeing a team of 20 employees, the candidate managed significant operations with cross-functional responsibilities, fitting the role of a Quality Manager (3A).

positionHistory.title: ERP Project manager (Infor LN)
positionHistory.description: Project Manager - Implementation of Infor LN (Legacy system: Baan 4) - Management of a team of 8 Key-Users - Management of external consultants.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As an ERP Project Manager leading the implementation of Infor LN, managing a team of 8 key users and external consultants, the candidate oversaw a significant project requiring coordination and strategic planning, fitting the role of a Senior Quality Supervisor (2C).

positionHistory.title: Quality and Safety Manager
positionHistory.description: Head of Quality and Safety for the Busch factory located in Switzerland (450 employees) - Management of 14 team members - Included Supplier Quality, Internal Quality, Customer Quality, Safety, Gauge calibration.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As the Head of Quality and Safety for the Busch factory, overseeing multiple quality functions and managing a team of 14 members in a facility with 450 employees, the candidate was responsible for strategic direction and achieving long-term objectives, fitting the role of a Quality Director (3C).

positionHistory.title: SAP Project Manager
positionHistory.description: Project Manager for the implementation of SAP S/4HANA - Move from Infor LN to SAP for all main modules. Management of a team of 10 Key-Users. Common project with the Busch German factory.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a SAP Project Manager leading the implementation of SAP S/4HANA across main modules, managing a team of 10 key users, and coordinating with another factory, the candidate managed significant operations with cross-functional responsibilities, fitting the role of a Quality Manager (3A).

positionHistory.title: Global Quality Manager
positionHistory.description: Head of Quality for Busch Manufacturing Companies (Germany, Switzerland, Czechia, UK, USA, Korea, India, China). Supplier, internal and customer Quality. Global Process Owner et Process Expert for QM Module in SAP S/4 HANA. Norms and regulations expert.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As the Global Quality Manager responsible for quality across multiple international manufacturing companies, integrating quality strategies with overall business objectives, and serving as the Global Process Owner, the candidate holds an executive leadership role fitting the definition of an Executive Director of Quality (4B).

cemalyilmaz.summary:
Ich bin Cemal Yilmaz, Head of Global Quality Management. Seit drei Jahren bin ich verantwortlich für das globale Qualitätsmanagement, Arbeitssicherheit und Umweltmanagement. Ich habe einen Diplom-Abschluss als Elektroingenieur FH, NDS in Qualitätsmanagement, und eine Ausbildung als Lean Experte. 

Mein Ziel ist es, die Kundenzufriedenheit und die Stimme des Kunden zu verbessern, indem ich die Produktqualität, die Prozessqualität und die Qualitätskultur kontinuierlich optimiere. Ich habe Erfahrung und bin Lead Auditor in der Nuklearen Qualitätssicherung nach ASME NQA-1, 10CFR50 App.B, 10CFR21 und bin sehr versiert mit den Anforderungen der ISO9001, ISO14001 und ISO45001. 

Ich wende Lean Six Sigma Methoden und Werkzeuge an, um die Ursachen von Fehlern zu analysieren und Qualitätsverbesserungsprojekte zu leiten. Ich arbeite eng mit internen und externen Partnern zusammen, um die Qualitätsstandards und die Kundenerwartungen zu erfüllen. 

Ich bin den operativen Tätigkeiten wie auch mit strategischem Qualitätsmanagement sehr vertraut.

positionHistory.title: Projekt Manager
positionHistory.description:
▪ Projektrealisierung bei den Energieversorgungsunternehmen
▪ Projektierung von Zählerfernauslesesoftware und Energiedatenmanagement-Software
▪ Schulung und Abnahme des Projektes
▪ Spezifikationen für die Entwicklungsabteilung sowie Schnittstellendefinitionen
▪ Ansprechpartner für alle Kunden.
▪ Weitere Aufgabe ist der Vertrieb der Hardware, die Parametrierung und die kundenspezifische Anpassung der Geräte
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Project Manager early in his career, he independently managed projects, interacted with customers, and implemented solutions, aligning with the responsibilities of a Mid-Level Quality Professional.

positionHistory.title: Projektingenieur
positionHistory.description:
▪ Projektierung von unterbrechungsfreien Stromversorgungs-Systemen (USV)
▪ Verantwortung für die Ausführung und das Controlling der internationalen Projekte
▪ Sicherstellung der terminlichen, qualitativen und finanziellen Projektziele
▪ Intensive Kontaktpflege zur internationalen Kundschaft und zu den Partnern
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Project Engineer responsible for the execution and control of international projects with significant autonomy and customer interaction, he fits the profile of a Senior Quality Professional.

positionHistory.title: Lean Manufacturing Manager

▪ Einführung von Lean Tools wie Little Train, 5S und Optimierung des gesamten Produktionsprozesses
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Lean Manufacturing Manager leading significant projects and implementing departmental process improvements, he fits the profile of a Mid-Level Quality Supervisor.

positionHistory.description: Skills: 8D-Problemlösungen · Beschwerdemanagement · Leadership · Managementsysteme · Interkulturelle Kompetenzen · Führung multikultureller Teams · Mitarbeiterführung · Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA) · Qualitätsprozesse · Audits · Strategische Personalplanung · ISO 14001 · Regulatorische Kenntnisse · Schnelle Auffassungsgabe · Deutsch · ASME NQA-1 Lead Auditor · NPS · Präsentationen · Nuclear Quality Assurance · Führungskompetenz · Analytische Fähigkeiten · Belastbarkeit · Teamführung · Pragmatik · Management Review · Verhandlungsführung · UPS-Systeme · Customer satisfaction · Kundenzufriedenheit · Leistungselektronik · CAQ · International · Interkulturelle Kompetenz · Problemlösung · Interkulturelle Kommunikation · Qualitätsaudit · Lieferanten-Qualitätsmanagement · Selbstständigkeit · Prozessverbesserung · Umweltmanagement, Gesundheitsschutz und Arbeitssicherheit (EHS) · Teammanagement · Microsoft Excel · 5S · ISO45001 · Qualitätsmanagementsystem · Analytische Kompetenz · Schulung
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Quality & Environmental Manager Worldwide, responsible for setting quality vision, managing global compliance, and leading international teams, he fits the profile of a Quality Director.

positionHistory.title: Customer Satisfaction & Quality Director
positionHistory.description: Skills: 8D-Problemlösungen · Beschwerdemanagement · Leadership · Managementsysteme · Interkulturelle Kompetenzen · Führung multikultureller Teams · Mitarbeiterführung · Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA) · Qualitätsprozesse · Audits · Strategische Personalplanung · ISO 14001 · Regulatorische Kenntnisse · Schnelle Auffassungsgabe · Deutsch · ASME NQA-1 Lead Auditor · NPS · Präsentationen · Nuclear Quality Assurance · Führungskompetenz · Analytische Fähigkeiten · Belastbarkeit · Teamführung · Pragmatik · Management Review · Verhandlungsführung · LTIR · UPS-Systeme · Customer satisfaction · Kundenzufriedenheit · Leistungselektronik · CAQ · International · Interkulturelle Kompetenz · Problemlösung · Interkulturelle Kommunikation · Qualitätsaudit · Lieferanten-Qualitätsmanagement · Selbstständigkeit · Prozessverbesserung · Umweltmanagement, Gesundheitsschutz und Arbeitssicherheit (EHS) · Teammanagement · Microsoft Excel · 5S · ISO45001 · Qualitätsmanagementsystem · Analytische Kompetenz · Schulung
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Customer Satisfaction & Quality Director, overseeing quality functions and customer satisfaction at a strategic level, influencing company policies, and managing global teams, he fits the profile of a Global Quality Leader.

positionHistory.title: Stiftungsratsmitglied Arbeitgeber
positionHistory.description: Skills: Schnelle Auffassungsgabe · Deutsch · 5S
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Serving as an employer representative on the pension fund's board demonstrates executive-level responsibilities and external representation, aligning with the profile of a Global Quality Leader.

positionHistory.title: Head of Global Quality Management
positionHistory.description:
Verantwortlich für das globale Qualitätsmanagement, Arbeitssicherheit und Umweltmanagement.
Produktentstehungsprozess-Qualität, Feldfehler Analyse und Qualitätsverbesserungsprojekte in der Serie Entwicklung.
Reduktion der Nonconformity Cost.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Head of Global Quality Management, holding ultimate responsibility for global quality strategies, integrating quality into all aspects of the business, and shaping organizational culture, he fits the profile of a Chief Quality Officer.

luiz-benacchio.summary: Dynamic senior leader in plant management, manufacturing, and operations. Overall 27 years of professional experience (8 years in South America, 12 years in Europe and 7 years in Asia), including short term assignments in Mexico, Romenia and China. MBA-educated with a sound foundation in business principles and senior leadership. Outstanding history of success in performance and operations management. Dedicated to optimizing manufacturing and engineering operations via lean principles. Well-versed in multinational and global management principles. Proven champion of cultural transformation, focused on quality assurance and operations. Demonstrated track record of elevating service delivery standards and customer satisfaction. Adept at uniting multinational teams behind corporate vision and empowering success. Renowned for identifying and pursuing lucrative new business opportunities.

positionHistory.title: QMS & Continuous Improvement Engineer
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a QMS & Continuous Improvement Engineer at Continental, Luiz began his professional career in quality, performing basic tasks under supervision, fitting the Entry-Level Quality Engineer role.

positionHistory.title: Supplier Quality Engineer
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Supplier Quality Engineer at Valeo, he gained several years of experience, managing supplier quality activities and handling moderately complex tasks, aligning with Mid-Level Quality Professionals.

positionHistory.title: Sourcing Coordinator
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Transitioned to a supervisory role as a Sourcing Coordinator at Ingersoll Rand, supervising a small team focused on sourcing operations, fitting the First-Line Quality Supervisor level.

positionHistory.title: Quality Manager
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Quality Manager at AKWEL, he managed the quality department, implemented strategies, managed staff, and achieved quality goals, corresponding to the Quality Manager level.

positionHistory.title: Corporate Quality Coordinator
positionHistory.description: Directed ongoing quality audits and interventions throughout global plants, liaising with colleagues at all levels to establish a worldwide standard for quality processes. Supervised a total of 6 internationally distributed quality managers. Provided reports and updates to the Board of Directors. Achievements include: reaching and maintaining a 100% record of customer- and- third-party-approved quality audits throughout Brazil, Mexico, Romania, and France; raising each new product launched to attain exceptional customer audit scores via launch of new sites in Mexico and Romania; and, obtaining board approval for all proposed corporate-level quality processes.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Corporate Quality Coordinator at AKWEL, supervising multiple quality managers globally and reporting to the Board, he fit the Quality Director role at an organizational level.

positionHistory.title: Quality Manager
positionHistory.description: Tasked with a full transformation of a 37-member quality team, utilizing restructuring, assessments, and process improvements to optimize performance. Pinpointed critical areas for improvement throughout existing operational systems. Defined and implemented a robust new structure with the necessary supporting systems. Achievements include: delivering significant improvements to core quality performance metrics for a highly complex organisation; deploying a new FMEA approach utilizing integrated TDC software; and, facilitating a corporate move to a new plant, with authority over all quality activities.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: At Faurecia as Quality Manager, overseeing a 37-member team and leading major quality initiatives, he aligned with the Senior Quality Manager level.

positionHistory.title: Regional Director of Quality
positionHistory.description: As key leader over a team of 100 personnel, coordinated all aspects of quality assurance and QA project management for the Hydro business area. Fostered adoption of best practices and standards, including ISO 9001-compliant quality guidelines. Liaised with customers and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment between processes and standards. Achievements include: turning around a historic trend of poor quality performance to elevate the unit to the best hydro unit for two consecutive years; transitioning the company from a quality control focus to a quality assurance / continuous improvement strategy; deploying a comprehensive new global quality plan within the local India operation; spearheading organizational restructure of the quality department, with more than 50 new team members recruited and a fully new departmental approach; and, significantly improving noncomformities detected at the customer end, resulting in a higher perception of quality performance among internal and external customer
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Regional Director of Quality at Alstom Power, overseeing a team of 100 and aligning quality initiatives regionally, he fits the Global Quality Leader role.

positionHistory.title: Regional Director of Operations
positionHistory.description: Strategic role and daily activities at the Hydro unit, leading 1,400 personnel throughout all areas of manufacturing, engineering, production, sourcing and logistics. Promoted organizational focus on quality, safety, and cost efficiency. Achievements include: upgrading the manufacturing operation for higher performance, with sustainable improvements across all KPIs via lean concepts and new operational systems; guiding the unit to achieve 3 consecutive elite Frost & Sullivan awards for lean manufacturing excellence; coordinating a number of successful new business initiatives that involved transfer of resources from other regions to boost production at the India operation; fostering a performance-oriented culture centered on continuous improvement principles with incentive programmes for Kaizen, EHS, 5S, and TPM projects; and, launching an HR programme to raise staff morale via professional development and support.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Serving as Regional Director of Operations at Alstom Power, leading 1,400 personnel across functions, he provided executive leadership consistent with Global Quality Leaders.

positionHistory.title: Factory & Unit Managing Director
positionHistory.companyLocation: Surabaya Area, East Java, Indonesia · On-site
positionHistory.description:
Promoted to control full P&L of Surabaya, Indonesia unit encompassing turnaround of 40M Euros annually , total of 600 employees (direct plus hired staff).
• Implemented Management Control Process as per Toyota Lean guidelines (KPI tree, escalation process, daily plant tour)
• Developed new business for the factory (Solar Boliers). 
• Improved drastically the safety performance of the factory (TOP 3 among Nuclear and 
Static manufacturing facilities in Alstom Thermal Power), achieving zero lost time
accident. 
• Successfully completed all customer ́s inspections and audits.
• Zero customer complaints.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Factory & Unit Managing Director at Alstom Power, with full P&L responsibility and overseeing the entire unit, he aligned with the Executive Director of Quality level.

positionHistory.title: Quality Director - Steam Power Systems India
positionHistory.description:
Being in a dual role in charge of overall Project, Supplier, Construction and Factory quality activities. I'm presently managing a team of 30 professionals. 
• Deployed quality assurance processes based on quality methodologies coming from top automotive companies
• Achieved the certification of Integrated Management System in 6 months (ISO 9001, 14001 and 18001)
• Improved drastically the overall supplier quality performance
• Qualified several suppliers for localization of critical components in India
• Recruited and coached a new Quality team during ramp up phase of a brand new factory in India
• Introduced new quality processes during project execution improving consistently main quality KPI's.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Quality Director at GE Power & Water in India, managing overall quality activities and a team of 30, he fits within the Global Quality Leader role.

positionHistory.title: Founder & Partner
positionHistory.description: Skills: Managing Start-ups
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Founder & Partner at Provence Consulting & Trading SAS, he provided executive leadership and managed start-up operations, consistent with Global Quality Leaders.

positionHistory.title: EMEA Quality Director
positionHistory.description: Reporting directly to Global Quality VP and in charge of Quality function for the entire EMEA region, I managed a total headcount of 80+ people located in several European countries (Germany, France, Poland, Czech Republic and UK) and in charge of Suppliers, Customers, QMS and Factory Quality related activities. Initially, I completely reorganized the Quality function at regional level and redefined roles and responsibilities across the business and established a comprehensive and structured warranty claim process. Additionally, I kicked off the ISO TS 22163 certification process (Railway business) in one of our factories located in UK.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As EMEA Quality Director at EnerSys, managing quality across the EMEA region and overseeing 80+ staff, he fits the Global Quality Leader level.

positionHistory.title: EMEA Senior Quality Director
positionHistory.description: Promoted to a Senior Director role. In continuation of main quality initiatives started in late 2018/beginning of 2019, the ISO/TS 22163 certification has been achieved. A new quality assurance process has been established for all regional factories focusing on critical items like problem solving, non-conformity management, poka-yoke and others with main short term target to reduce customer claims.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Promoted to EMEA Senior Quality Director at EnerSys, he provided executive leadership and integrated quality strategies into business objectives, aligning with Executive Directors of Quality.

positionHistory.title: EMEA & Global Quality Operations Senior Director
positionHistory.description: Having succeeded in implementing a robust quality assurance process in EMEA factories, I had my scope of factories enlarged including 3 factories in USA. During this period of time, I have also started the IATF16949 certification activities to address customer automotive requirements in one of our factories in France. On top of that, Global Supplier Quality requirements were deployed to our regional strategic suppliers focusing on improving the overall quality performance in terms of claims and defective parts. I have also been part of a Global cross-functional team in charge to define Lean principles and its maturity assessment.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As EMEA & Global Quality Operations Senior Director, overseeing global quality operations and contributing to strategic planning, he fits the Executive Director of Quality level.

positionHistory.title: EMEA & APAC and Global Advanced Quality Senior Director
positionHistory.description: As a next step in my career path, I got additionally the entire APAC region and the New Product Development (APQP) as part of my new Quality scope, having in total 100+ people in the team. In terms of achievements, IATF 16949 certification was reached in 2 factories located respectively in France and UK; significant improvements in terms of customer quality KPIs in the last 3 years (warranty cost reduced by almost 50% and customer rejection rate in PPM by 80%); similarly, the supplier quality rejection rate reduced by more than 70%.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As EMEA & APAC and Global Advanced Quality Senior Director, integrating quality strategies globally and leading advanced functions, he aligns with Executive Directors of Quality.

positionHistory.title: EMEA & APAC and Global Supplier Quality Senior Director
positionHistory.description: As part of my newly added scope, I'm also in charge of defining and implementing the global supplier quality strategy with a special focus on strategic suppliers located in Asia.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Currently, as EMEA & APAC and Global Supplier Quality Senior Director, defining global supplier quality strategy, he provides executive leadership consistent with Executive Directors of Quality.

hamiltonparise.summary:
Experienced in the implementation and sustainability of the product Quality, production Quality and Quality Management Systems, successfully targeting the customer satisfaction in all aspects of production, supply-chain and for launching of new products.

Skilled in the Automotive Industry cluster, recognizing and exercising the value of collaboration to improve Quality between the OEM and Suppliers (Tier1 and Tier2), under respect of international and specific automotive norms and standards.

Mentor capable of taking decisions having self-assertion, self-autonomy and proactive within the right usage of the Quality management techniques and tools for problem solving and improvement of processes.

Green-Field experienced, deploying to corporations, international standard procedures, defining and establishing should-be conditions to new sites and launching safely new products, having never stopped any customer’s production line.

Certified Licensed Third-party Lead auditor for the following international standards:
• IATF 16949:2016 Automotive Quality Management System
• ISO 45001:2018 Occupational Health and Safety
• ISO 14001:2015 Environmental Management System
• ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System

Certified ISO/IEC 27001 Information Security Officer & 27001 ISMS Auditor having profound knowledge of the requirements and the deployment of TISAX for readiness assessments.

Certified VDA 6.3:2023 Process Auditor (1st Party / 2nd Party)

positionHistory.title: Product Coordinator – Product Engineering
positionHistory.description:
Product Coordinator for Dashboard, HVAC, Seats and interior side Panel Covers from the development phase to the pre-series phase and launch of series production of the MPV VW Sharan, SEAT Alhambra und FORD Galaxy in the Product Engineering department at Volkswagen Autoeuropa.

• Execution and coordination of technical changes
• Feasibility studies and coordination of functional builds
• Support the launch of Pre-Series vehicles for Endurance, Crash, Press Cars
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Product Coordinator, coordinating technical changes and feasibility studies, supporting pre-series launches, his responsibilities align with those of a mid-level quality professional.

positionHistory.title: Representative R&D – Technical Resident
positionHistory.description:
Strategically some VW platforms or models are shared among the VW-Group and Brands. SEAT developed the MPV Alhambra based on the VW-Sharan by modifying and introducing specific corporate design and market requirements.

On the Facelift project of the MPV Alhambra - Key contact for all matters between SEAT R&D in Martorell, Spain and VW-Autoeuropa, allocated in Palmela at the Volkswagen plant in Portugal to ensure and coordinate the introduction to serial production of specific Facelift content.

• During Pre-Series coordinate parts for the sampling, support on develop and validate suppliers, cubing and release of components
• Monitoring and releasing all Pre-Series or Press cars within project specific content
• Ensure and coordinate the production planning with the availability of specific parts, design of the vehicle combination matrix
• Ensure the launch of the product according to the PRD - Product Requirements Document ( Lastenheft )
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Serving as the key contact between SEAT R&D and VW-Autoeuropa, coordinating significant product launch activities, he held responsibilities typical of a senior quality professional.

positionHistory.title: Product Coordinator Interior – Product Engineering
positionHistory.companyName: MAGNA STEYR Fahrzeugtechnik AG & Co KG
positionHistory.description:
Product Coordinator for Interior and middle console during the development and the pre-series phase of the BMW – X3 vehicle executed by Magna Steyer in Graz, Austria

• Contribution for the development and design changes
• Execution and coordination of technical changes
• Feasibility studies and technical coordination with Engineering and Purchasing BMW
• Support the launch of Pre-Series vehicles for Endurance, Crash, Press and Catalogue
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Coordinating technical changes and acting as liaison with BMW Engineering and Purchasing, leading significant projects, his role aligns with a senior quality professional.

positionHistory.title: Buy Part Engineer - Quality Assurance
positionHistory.description:
Supplier Development Eng. in the Quality Buy Parts department at Volkswagen Autoeuropa

Responsible for the scope of supply on the VW-EOS Cabrio (VW465) project for the the 5 segmented Hard Top Cabrio Roof from the supplier Webasto containing 475 single components such as steel parts, hydraulics, glass, rubbers, plastics and textiles down to fastened elements, wire harnesses, electrical motors and sensorics.

Fully dedicated to this project since the vehicle development to the SOP ensuring the right execution of Quality relevant requirements on all steps during the product creation process - PEP ( Produkt-Entstehungs-Prozess ) and monitoring, evaluating, supporting and developing the supplier production readiness.

• Ensure the launch of the product according to the PRD - Product Requirements Document ( LH )
• Execution of Product and Process Capability Studies
• Acceptance of measuring concepts and measuring processes
• Acceptance and Release of Pre-Series tools, Production Line, Gauges and Processes
• Execution Qualification Audits for new suppliers
• Validation and release of the sub-suppliers main supply chain process and service providers such as JIT Paintshop, Stamped Steel Parts and Fabric Supplier
• Acceptance and release of Initial Samples and PSWs – Part Submission Warrants
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Supplier Development Engineer responsible for critical supplier quality activities, leading efforts to ensure supplier readiness and compliance, his responsibilities align with those of a senior quality professional.

positionHistory.title: Plant Change Manager - Change Manager Coordinator
positionHistory.description:
Change Manager Coordinator at Webasto-AG Automotive.

During the series production of the 5 segmented Hard Top Cabrio Roof for the Volkswagen EOS (VW465), responsible to coordinate and release Technical Changes in the subsidiary Webasto plant on the JIT Supplier Park in Palmela, Portugal.

• Coordination of Change Requests by collecting costs, feasibility studies and functional builds results
• Review changes within the customer to kickoff the changes and set the implementation dates
• Coordination of PCO – Product Cost Optimization collecting saving potentials on the product or processes reflecting to an internal manufacturing piece price reduction strengthening the company’s profit grow
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Plant Change Manager, coordinating and releasing technical changes at the plant level and supervising change management activities, his role aligns with a first-line quality supervisor.

positionHistory.title: Quality Assurance – Resident Engineer
positionHistory.description:
Volkswagen Individual develops and produces the Volkswagen "R" series by face-lifting current mass production cars with an exclusive sportive vehicle package.

For the Project Scirocco R - Key contact for all Quality matters between VW-Individual in Wolfsburg and VW Autoeuropa, allocated in Palmela at the Volkswagen plant in Portugal to ensure and coordinate the introduction to serial production of specific "R" content.

• During Pre-Series Initiate the sampling, develop and validate suppliers, cubing and release of components
• Validate and implement last minute Engineering changes before SOP, acceptance of risk releases
• Fine-tune PDMs for the Production Process, establish permissible fault catalogue and set PPM targets
• Monitoring and releasing all Pre-Series cars or Press Scirocco within project specific R content
• Ensure production planning with the availability of specific parts, design of the vehicle combination matrix
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Acting as the key quality contact between VW-Individual and VW Autoeuropa, coordinating significant quality activities, he held responsibilities typical of a senior quality professional.

positionHistory.title: Customer Quality Manager - Automotive
positionHistory.description:
Customer Quality Manager (Quality Assurance) Automotive

Ensure the customer satisfaction for a long lasting and profitable business, put in place the contractual settlements for customer care and cost oriented problem solving. Strong development of the EU Manufacturing plants by deploying and improving the local Quality systems, processes and standards.

• First class key contact for all Quality matters between JE and customers
• Coordination of customer complaints – Handling and Resolution (PDCA)
• Execute and track customer VDA audits, implement, validate and execute the incurred corrective needs
• Implement and sustain of an internal and external complaint reduction plan
• Reinforce Quality on Product development, ratio-projects and relocation of production lines
• Execute and challenge the team to CIPs - Continuously Improvement Programs
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Customer Quality Manager at the EU headquarters, overseeing quality across multiple manufacturing plants and leading strategic initiatives, his role aligns with a senior quality manager.

positionHistory.title: Quality & Reliability Europe – EU Manufacturing Footprint Dev.
positionHistory.description:
European Manufacturing Footprint Development – Launch of new production sites.

Project leadership to deploy the Quality Assurance to the new European plants to continuously support the improvement of a competitive production footprint.

• Define and Deploy new Quality site organizational structure, ensure the fulfillment of the resources for machines and headcount
• Define the new site budget including the acquisition of laboratory equipment, gauges and validation devices
• Define the Quality tasks for project specific sourcing strategy from the validation, communication up to the release coordination
• Define the necessary milestones to implement and be compliant with the internal and with the customer expectations such as material validation, production lines and tools relocations validation trough PV, R@R, PAPP, Capability and Feasibility studies
• Define and implement the execution of product specific safe-launch concepts such as firewalls GP12 / CSLs
• Provide testing capacity, manage and track product validation process and life-time tests
• Drive the new organization and site to the Quality Group standards and processes ( COPs, SOPs, tools ) and follow the necessary improvement plan with the site Q Team during ramp-up
• Lead the SOP readiness for tools and production assembly lines ( Launch Management )
• Successful drive the new site obtaining ISO management systems certifications
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Leading Quality & Reliability for Europe, launching new production sites, defining quality strategies, and overseeing operations across multiple plants, his role aligns with a global quality leader.

positionHistory.title: Lead Auditor
positionHistory.companyName: SQS - Swiss Association for Quality and Management Systems
positionHistory.description:
The Swiss Association for Quality and Management Systems (SQS) and member of IQNet, is Switzerland's leading organization for certification and assessment services, equally known as Certification Body.

Actively auditing national and international industrial organizations, verifying that the organization has succeeded in the endeavor of accomplishing all requirements to meet the requirements of the chosen standard, and that continues to meet the requirements on an ongoing basis.

Certified 3rd Party Auditor:
 • ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System
 • ISO 14001:2015 Environmental Management Systems
 • ISO 45001:2018 Occupational Health and Safety
 • IATF 16949 Automotive Quality Management Systems

Preparation and execution of initial certification audits, surveillance audits and re-certification audits under respect of the requirement of the ISO-17021-1:2015 and the regulations: IAF MD 1, IAF MD 2, IAF MD 5, IAF MD 6, IAF MD 9, IAF MD 11 and IAF MD 18.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Lead Auditor conducting complex audits for multiple international standards with significant expertise, his responsibilities align with those of a senior quality professional.

positionHistory.title: Corporate Management System, Information Security and Supplier Auditor
positionHistory.description:
Corporate Internal Information Security and TISAX© Audits, External 2nd Party VDA 6.3 Process Audits and IATF Internal Corporate Audits.

thyssenkrupp Presta AG having overall, a total of approx. 10,900 employees worldwide work in 24 plants and development facilities in Liechtenstein, Switzerland, Germany, France, Poland, Hungary, Mexico, Brazil, the USA, China and Japan. Steering systems for more than 30 million vehicles per year are developed and produced. Eschen in Liechtenstein has approx. 2,500 employees, and is the core of the Business Unit. The automotive environment is being shaped by autonomous driving, connectivity and powertrain electrification. In Liechtenstein, the team is focused on helping to shape these megatrends. In future, too, they will pick up new development trends in the fields of chassis and steering, and bring them to market readiness. On the basis of these steering technologies, work is further progressing on development projects such as steer-by-wire and the further development of steering assist systems as the preliminary stage to autonomous driving.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Conducting corporate-level audits across multiple sites and functions with significant expertise, his role aligns with that of a senior quality professional.

positionHistory.title: Head of Audit Management
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Head of Audit Management, overseeing the audit function and integrating quality strategies across the organization, his role aligns with an executive director of quality.

sergeromming.summary:
Quality director with experience in all aspects of quality (production, supplier, system, project). Particulary interested in problem solving and quality management methods (QRQC), process oriented quality system and project management.
International experience  working in French, English, German and Czech (11 years in the Czech Republic / 3 years in Germany / 10 years in Switzerland). Focus on management by indicators and customer satisfaction.

Specialties: Internal system and process audits, QRQC training (Quick Response Quality Control), Quality tools and methods (FMEA, SPC, DOE, VA and FA), international standards (ISO TS, VDA, QS9000).

positionHistory.title: Quality Engineer - Customer care
positionHistory.description:
Faurecia (~850 employees, turnover 80 M€/year) – Location: Tabor (Czech Republic)

- set up of problem working groups
- set up of regular customer visits and defects analysis
- set up of detailed indicators in the shopfloor
- implementation of process FMEA
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Quality Engineer, Serge worked independently on quality projects such as setting up problem working groups, customer visits, defects analysis, and implementing process FMEA. These responsibilities align with mid-level quality professionals (1B), who have several years of experience and handle moderately complex tasks.

positionHistory.title: Plant Quality Manager
positionHistory.description:
Faurecia (~850 employees, turnover 80 M€/year) – Location: Tabor (Czech Republic)

- Implementation of a quality system according to German (VDA 6.1) and American (QS 9000) automotive standards
- Implementation of regular qualification audits at supplier
- Implementation of internal process/system audits
- deployment of preventive methods for all new projects (P-FMEA)
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As a Plant Quality Manager, Serge managed the quality department, implemented quality systems according to international automotive standards, and conducted supplier and internal audits. This role aligns with Quality Managers (3A), who oversee quality operations at the plant level with high complexity and moderate to high autonomy.

positionHistory.title: Industrialization Manager
positionHistory.description:
Faurecia (~850 employees, turnover 80 M€/year) – Location: Tabor (Czech Republic)

- Reorganization of the department oriented to customer needs
- Introduction of indicators oriented to technical productivities
- Introduction of a time evaluation system with the use of time cards (MTM, GSD)
- Standardization of internal working methods in line with customer needs
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: In his role as Industrialization Manager, Serge reorganized the department, introduced productivity indicators, and standardized internal methods. These strategic responsibilities correspond to a Quality Manager (3A), focusing on departmental improvements with high complexity.

positionHistory.title: Division Quality Director - Valeo Compressor Europe
positionHistory.description:
Valeo Compressor (~1000 employees, turnover 200 M€/year) – European Division – Location: Humpolec (Greenfield plant in Czech Republic), Hockenheim and Ludwigsburg (Germany)

- Implementation of a common quality system for the three locations of the division conforming to ISO TS 16949: 2002
- Deployment of the Valeo Group Quality strategy based on the QRQC (Quick Response Quality Control)
-  Management of the Quality within the project development phases in line with Valeo and customer standards (ANPQP for Renault/Nissan, QPN for Volkswagen, APQP for Volvo/Ford and Fiat,)
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Division Quality Director for Valeo Compressor Europe, overseeing quality across three locations, Serge's role involved strategic planning and implementation of a common quality system. This position fits the profile of a Quality Director (3C), with responsibilities at a divisional level involving strategic direction and significant impact.

positionHistory.title: Division Quality Director - Valeo Climate Control
positionHistory.description:
Valeo Climate control (~1000 employees, turnover 250 M€/year) – Czech Division – Location: Rakovnik (Czech Republic)

- Reduction of the warranty costs by systematical analysis of returned parts and regular negociation with customer
- Reinforcement of the Valeo strategy deployment based on the 5 axes
- Reinforcement of the QRQC (Quick Response Quality Control) methodology deployment
- Reinforcement of the Quality control during the launch of new projects (regular Project Validation Committee)
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Continuing as Division Quality Director at Valeo Climate Control, Serge reinforced group strategies and quality methodologies, impacting the entire division. This aligns with the role of a Quality Director (3C), managing complex responsibilities at a divisional level.

positionHistory.title: Quality Director North East Europe Activity - Valeo Climate Control
positionHistory.companyLocation: Bad Rodach, Germany - Rakovnik, Czech Republic
positionHistory.description:
Valeo Climate Control (~1600 employees, turnover 450 M€/year) – North East Europe Activity – Location: Rakovnik (Czech Republic), Bad Rodach (Germany), Frosinone (Italy), Goteborg (Sweden)

- Deployment of the Group Quality Strategy within the production and new projects (PFMEA review on the shop floor, implementation of Special Characteristics control)
- Deployment of the Group Quality Strategy at suppliers (Top Worst Supplier, Commodity Check Lists, new VRF, ...)
- Reinforcement of the QRQC (Quick Response Quality Control) methodology 
- Reinforcement of the Quality control during the launch of new projects (regular Project Validation Committee : 6 new projects)
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Quality Director North East Europe Activity, Serge oversaw quality across multiple countries, deploying group strategies and reinforcing methodologies. This regional scope and strategic influence align with Global Quality Leaders (4A), who manage quality functions across regions.

positionHistory.title: Product Group Quality Director - Valeo Transmission Systems
positionHistory.description:
Valeo Transmission Systems (~4500 employees, turnover 900 M€/year) – 14 plants, 2 Research centers and 7 Development centers in 10 countries 
– Implementation of a new Group Organization → active participation in the definition and deployment of the new Quality organization for the Product Group Transmissions to improve the efficiency and the reactivity
– Deployment of the Group Quality Strategy in all sites → regular On Job Training on site to implement Special Product and Process Characteristics control, FMEA on shop floor, QRQC (Quick Response Quality Control) problem solving, logical thinking and project validation committees
– Implementation of 0ppb action plan → weekly review with main contributing sites to improve Customer Line returns, Warranty, Project Launches and Non Quality Costs
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: In his role as Product Group Quality Director for Valeo Transmission Systems, overseeing quality across 14 plants in 10 countries, Serge's extensive global responsibilities and strategic impact align with an Executive Director of Quality (4B).

positionHistory.title: Quality & Reliability Director Europe
positionHistory.description:
Johnson Electric Europe (~3500 employees, turnover 650 M€/year) – 7 plants in Europe :  Hungary, Poland, Italy, Switzerland, France, Germany and Import business from China
– Define the Quality Organization for Europe → define and implement the "should be condition"
– Define and deploy a Quality Strategy in all sites → regular On Job Training on site to implement FMEA on shop floor, QRQC (Quick Response Quality Control) problem solving, and logical thinking 
– Define and Implement a 0ppb action plan and key Quality KPIs→ weekly review to improve Customer Line returns, Warranty, Project launch and Non Quality Costs leading to 50% reduction in 1 year
– Support the Operations in relocation of tools and lines → closure of 1 site in Germany and extension of the sites in Hungary and Poland
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Quality & Reliability Director Europe at Johnson Electric, Serge defined and deployed quality strategies across seven European plants. This role fits Global Quality Leaders (4A), with regional scope and significant strategic responsibilities.

positionHistory.title: Head of Quality & Reliability Europe
positionHistory.description: Ramp up a new manufacturing facility in Serbia : relocation of production lines from China to Serbia including strong vertical integration (stamping, injection moulding, coating,...) without quality issues (< 3ppm at customer and <500 ppm internaly) and logistic disturbances.
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: As Head of Quality & Reliability Europe, Serge led significant initiatives like ramping up a new facility and relocating production lines. His extensive leadership responsibilities and strategic impact correspond to an Executive Director of Quality (4B).

positionHistory.title: Head of Quality Europe & Americas
positionHistory.seniorityExplanation: Currently, as Head of Quality Europe & Americas, Serge oversees quality across two major regions. His ultimate decision-making authority and organization-wide impact align with a Chief Quality Officer (4C), responsible for overall strategy and execution.
